sub_title: Specialist in Urban Land, Housing Development & Capacity Building
summary:
Charmae Pyl Wissink-Nercua is part of the Urban Socio-Spatial Development Department at IHS. Her expertise is in urban land and housing development, focusing on governance, sustainability, and resilience. Charmae has more than 15 years of professional experience in the field. She is currently working on the themes of nature-based solutions, sustainable urban development, land and housing rights, climate adaptation planning, climate resilience, urban living labs, stakeholders’ engagement and co-design and co-creation processes.

At IHS, Charmae is involved in education, research, advisory and capacity-building activities. She coordinates the Sustainable Urban Development (SUD) course and is actively engaged in IHS’ project acquisitions, and is leading various projects such as international tailormade trainings and refresher courses in Africa, Asia, Latin America and Europe.

Before joining IHS in 2013, she worked for local government organizations, non-government organizations and national governments in the Philippines and East Timor, focusing on housing & land issues, participatory governance, participatory community development and urban poverty reduction programs. She has extensive experience in project development and management, strategic planning and network-building.

In the Philippines, she was very passionate about advocating for the land and housing rights of the urban poor and the vulnerable sectors in society. In her stint as the urban poor and social housing consultant of Cebu City, Philippines, she was involved in the development and implementation of community-based land and housing programs such as the Community Mortgage Program (CMP) and in implementing participatory and multi-sectoral processes on issues of land tenure security, evictions and resettlement, and the urban poor’s access to basic services like water, health and sanitation services. At Dili, Timor Leste (East Timor), she provided full guidance and advice to the Directorate on Housing and Building under the Ministry of Public Works and Infrastructure regarding the formulation, policy lobbying and implementation of the National Housing Policy and the National Housing Program.

Key words: capacity-building, institution development, housing expert, land governance, land management, resilient housing, nature-based solutions, community development, participatory governance

treasury_media.title: Sustainable Urban Development
treasury_media.description: Designed for contemporary urban professionals, the Sustainable Urban Development (SUD) programme is a five-week short course anchored in the SDG 11 "Sustainable Cities and Communities". It is designed to provide participants with the knowledge and skills to understand, analyse and develop strategies to achieve the SDG 11 targets, "Making cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable", and produce localized solutions.

education.degree_name: Sustainable Land Use Planning E-learning Course

school.name: St. Theresa's College, Cebu City, Philippines

company.name: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description:
Charmae Pyl Wissink-Nercua is part of the Urban Socio-Spatial Development Team at IHS. Her expertise is in urban land and housing development with a focus on governance, sustainability, and resilience aspects. Charmae has more than 15 years of professional experience in the field. She is currently working on the themes of nature-based solutions, sustainable urban development, land and housing rights, climate adaptation planning, climate resilience, urban living labs, stakeholders’ engagement and co-design and co-creation processes.

At IHS, Charmae is involved in education, research, advisory and capacity-building activities. She coordinates the Sustainable Urban Development (SUD) course and teaches at Land Management: Law, Finance, Real Estate and Natural Resources Master track. She is actively involved in IHS’ project acquisitions and is leading various projects such as international tailormade trainings and refresher courses in Africa, Asia, Latin America and Europe.

Before joining IHS in 2013, she worked for local government organizations, non-government organizations and national governments in the Philippines and East Timor focusing on housing & land issues, participatory governance, participatory community development and urban poverty reduction programs. She has extensive experience in project development and management, strategic planning and network-building.

Charmae obtained her MSc in Urban Management and Development, specializing in Housing and Land Development strategies, Cum laude at IHS in 2009. Her current research interest is in the interaction between science and society and the role of nature-based living labs in addressing climate change challenges in the context of coastal cities in Europe.

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description:
At IHS, I am managing the alumni relations activities which includes organizing alumni events (both national & international); secretariat support to the IHS alumni network; organizing & promoting Refresher Courses; connecting alumni to projects and research, alumni database management, etc.

I am also the account manager for the African region, Philippines and India. Tasks include implementing a sales/recruitment strategy; leads management, event organization (international educational fairs), social media management, partnership development, international relations, etc.
profile_positions.title: Alumni Relations Manager
Freelance Urban Management and Development Consultant

profile_positions.description: Responsible in assisting the Manager Advocacy- Land of Promise Campaign in stimulating brand owners in the Philippine Pineapple Industry to increase the levels of sustainability and transparency associated with their products; expands and updates FI’s database of food and beverage companies that can be approached as advocacy targets; research on sustainability trends and finally approach companies/ brandowners to introduce Fairfood International.

company.name: Kaabag sa Sugbo (a network of Social Development NGOs in Cebu)

profile_positions.description: Led in the drafting of the Implementing Rules and Regulations of the Cebu City Shelter Framework and further drafted a Land Acquisition, Valuation and Disposition of Socialized Housing Ordinance/ Policy which has been approved by the Cebu City Council.
profile_positions.title: Housing Policy Consultant

profile_positions.description: Provided full guidance and advice to the Ministry of Infrastructure towards the formulation, policy lobbying and implementation of the National Housing Policy and the National Housing Program; developed the required research methodology and undertook the necessary processes towards the formulation of the integrated national housing program including the basic services and social infrastructure along with it; ensured that participatory processes towards program formulation were utilized through the conduct and facilitation of inter-agency meetings, multi-sectoral consultations and public hearings.
profile_positions.title: Consultant, National Directorate on Building, Housing and Urban Planning

company.name: Cebu City Division for the Welfare of the Urban Poor

profile_positions.company: Cebu City Division for the Welfare of the Urban Poor
profile_positions.description: Provided strategic direction to the local government’s frontline service organization for the urban poor in terms of organizational management and development including installation of PIME (Planning, Implementation, Monitoring and Evaluation) systems; facilitated annual planning and assessment; led in the formulation of anti-poverty alleviation programs and ensured efficient and effective implementation of these programs.
profile_positions.title: Consultant on Social Housing and Poverty Alleviation

profile_positions.description: Initiated, sustained and supported local, national and international campaigns to advance urban poor agenda; responsible for taking advocacy campaigns and initiatives on sectoral and multi-sectoral issues with partner communities in coordination with community organizers; implemented organizations’ urban poor programs funded by Christian Aid UK, Cordaid Netherlands and Misereor of Germany; monitored and evaluated FORGE’s prostituted women and children program  dubbed as “Rescuing sexually exploited children under Eighteen (RESCUE); media liasoning for advocacy work.
profile_positions.title: Policy Advocacy Officer

profile_positions.description: Took full responsibility for the formulation and implementation of FORGE’s capacity-building and/or Education and Training plan; led in module preparations, conducting and managing training/seminars for partner urban poor communities. Seminars conducted include: leadership and teambuilding training, community organizing towards community development, gender and development training, basic community organizer’s training, participatory programme management training, participatory governance trainings, feasibility study and business planning and livelihoods training; disaster response, preparedness and recovery training.
profile_positions.title: Education and Training Officer

profile_positions.description: Responsible in the implementation of the school's marketing and communication strategic plan; person-in-charge in Press Releases, Radio/TV advertisements, Student publications, School Campaign; Taught English and Mass Communication subjects.
